stories.title: Pixa.Pics – A pixel art editor inspired by Google MD

stories.text:
In my experience in the machine learning field I have seen that many teams are not leveraging the full potential of the technology. In the majority of the cases I see, people deploy models in batch jobs, what is often called "batch prediction".

Although I agree that this is useful for some specific cases (keep it simple), I suspect that often the decision was made because of engineering limitations, and not because it was the best for the project.

If you deploy ML models, please share what's the model deployment strategy you're using (batch, online or event-based) and why you decided going with it.

ps.: my team and I are working in an end-to-end serverless platform for ML, so your inputs will help us shape the product.
stories.title: For ML practitioners: why are you doing batch predictions?
